answers.answer: This is most likely hypothyroidism due to autoimmune thyroid disease, Hashimoto's.  However there are cases of transient thyroid abnormalities that did not require long-term treatment in these cases repeating tests can help clarify the situation.

question: Recently diagnosed with T2 Diabetes. Complete lab work up done and all tests perfectly normal except my TSH was at 23. Also two days before the test was done had 2 teeth pulled and recently had a chest cold. Dr wants to repeat test at some point but till then do I need to worry about this? I keep reading about all these Autoimmunes that cause Hypothyroidism and am worried it could be something serious. Any help would be greatly appreciated.
title: TSH 23
